title: Architecture
description:
Gazel's layer and feature system allows you to create any type of software
architecture to suit different needs. In this system, layers and features form
a matrix which we call an application.

children.value:
Gazel's layer and feature system allows you to create any type of software
architecture to suit different needs. In this system, layers and features form
a matrix which we call an application.

consists of layers and features. It is designed according to
an architectural pattern. For example,

introduces a new framework, library or SDK for an application to
have a base to be configured. For example,

introduces
NHibernate, IoC Layer introduces Windsor and so on.

configures one or more layers to make a certain functionality
available to your application. For example, the feature

, so that it can log
service requests as well as it adds audit columns to entities.

Assume we have an application with two layers and two features, below diagram
represents this application from layer perspective;
This is an application with two layers
Let's look at the same application from feature perspective;
Here you can see that this is an application with two features;
with their configurations to relevant layers.

The difference between a layer and a feature is that a layer continue to
exist without a configuration from a feature. So it only contains
configurations from features. On the other hand, features consist of
configurations, without them there won't be any features.
Finally you can see above application from application perspective;
Now that you have learned three basic concepts
, it is time to move on to next section.

title: Conventions
description:
In this section you will learn about the conventions in Gazel. Keep in mind
that Gazel heavily relies on Convention over Configuration design paradigm.

title: Features
description:
Features are built-in behaviours that can be customized through their
configurers. Small features can be named as Configuration or Option. When
they only configure an existing behaviour, such as DatabaseConfiguration, it
is a Configuration. When they provide nothing to configure other than
enable/disable, such as UtcOption, it is an Option.

children.value:
Features are built-in behaviours that can be customized through their
configurers. Small features can be named as

. When
they only configure an existing behaviour, such as

. When they provide nothing to configure other than
enable/disable, such as

: Learn what alternatives you have in
Gazel to provide authentication in your projects

: Provides a default
concurrency limiter for your backend to perform well under high loads.

: Crypto provides a built-in way to encrypt & decrypt
sensitive data

: Gazel has a prebuilt code &
message system that converts exceptions into data

: File system gives a nice abstraction for
your application to read & write file
Below sample illustrates how you can configure a service application;

props.code:
builder.Services.AddGazelServiceApplication(cfg,
    ...
    service: c => ...,
    audit: c => ...,
    authentication: c => ...,
    ...
);

children.value:
builder.Services.AddGazelServiceApplication(cfg,
    ...
    service: c => ...,
    audit: c => ...,
    authentication: c => ...,
    ...
);

Each application type have different set of features. To learn more about
applications and their features, please have a look at the

In this section we will go through every feature available in Gazel and explain
how you can configure them using their configurers.

title: Release Notes

children.value: Here you can find what's new in Gazel. We follow

: Starting from v5.x.x, this part will follow major .NET releases
without backward compatibility. So if Gazel is on v5.x.x then it is
compatible with .NET 5, if it is v6.x.x then it is compatible with .NET 6,
and so on.

: When there is a new feature or a breaking change on top of an
existing major release, it means it is a minor release.

: When new release only includes a bugfix or an improvement without
a new feature or breaking change, it is only a patch.
Here you can find what's new in Gazel. We follow

existing major release, it means it is a minor release.

: When new release only includes a bugfix or an improvement without
a new feature or breaking change, it is only a patch.

title: Setup
description: Here you will learn how to setup your solution and projects to use Gazel.

children.value: Here you will learn how to setup your solution and projects to use Gazel.

: Create a Gazel solution, add
and configure your hosts.

your solution.

title: Getting Started
description:
This is a tutorial that aims to help you to understand how to write a backend
using Gazel. Before you begin, you need to create an empty solution.

children.value:
This is a tutorial that aims to help you to understand how to write a backend
using Gazel. Before you begin, you need to create an empty solution.

to start right away. Once you open this
solution, directory structure should look like this:

props.code:
Inventiv.Sample
├── src
│   ├── Inventiv.Sample.App.Rest
│   ├── Inventiv.Sample.App.Service
│   └── Inventiv.Sample.Module.Todo
└── test
    └── Inventiv.Sample.Test.Todo

children.value:
Inventiv.Sample
├── src
│   ├── Inventiv.Sample.App.Rest
│   ├── Inventiv.Sample.App.Service
│   └── Inventiv.Sample.Module.Todo
└── test
    └── Inventiv.Sample.Test.Todo

If you want to create an empty solution on your own, have a look at below
pages;
Basically, you will need to create a new solution named

and
add a new business module named
Now that you have done this, you are ready to get started 🚀
